quotes.quote: Sometimes, things may not go your way, but the effort should be there every single night.
Productivity is never an accident. It is always the result of a commitment to excellence, intelligent planning, and focused effort.
Good well-being promotes good productivity.
If you're going through hell, keep going.
Writing crystallizes thought and thought produces action.
Productivity is driven at the enterprise level. Better wages, better performing workplaces, are driven at the workplace level.
Connectivity is productivity whether it's in a modern office or an underdeveloped village.
It's not knowing what to do, it's doing what you know.
Productivity is being able to do things that you were never able to do before.
Even though worker capacity and motivation are destroyed when leaders choose power over productivity, it appears that bosses would rather be in control than have the organization work well.
Individual income can grow only as fast as productivity rises.
Nothing is less productive than to make more efficient what should not be done at all.
Improve quality, you automatically improve productivity.
Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.
Improved productivity means less human sweat, not more.
Your mind is for having ideas, not holding them.
Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
The path to success is to take massive, determined action.
Stressing output is the key to improving productivity, while looking to increase activity can result in just the opposite.
The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
There is no substitute for hard work.
Progress occurs where truths are questioned.
If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.
All mankind is divided into three classes: those that are immovable, those that are movable, and those that move.
Create with the heart; build with the mind.
Don't allow idleness to deceive you, for while you give him today, he steals tomorrow from you.
The productivity of a work group seems to depend on how the group members see their own goals in relation to the goals of the organization.
My goal is no longer to get more done, but rather to have less to do.
The simple act of paying positive attention to people has a great deal to do with productivity.
